name: Uniform continuity - Wikipediaen.wikipedia.org › wiki › Uniform_continuity
description:
In mathematics, a function f is uniformly continuous if, roughly speaking, it is possible to guarantee that f(x) and f(y) be as close to each other as we please by requiring only that x and y are sufficiently close to each other; unlike ordinary continuity, where the maximum distance between f(x) and f(y) may depend on ...
